title: 【再推】La La Land改編革命歌！一齊將時代革命打入荷里活

replies.msg:
La la land 革命歌
一推再推
咁認真嘅one man team製作都無人理
中文比手足聽 英文比國際線聽

想叫大家 不如一齊send比原曲composer Justin Hurwitz, 佢係美國黎巴嫩猶太後裔 同佢講首歌記載咗香港人有爭取自由嘅共同回憶同共鳴
佢可能會鍾意

英文版：
https://youtu.be/fpLTOmgc2Rk

中文版：
https://youtu.be/o-PXXfIN77c


利申：好鍾意睇La La Land


以下原文來自手足youtube channel：

//
一年。
舊年呢個時候，我為一個陌生人流眼淚，呢種感覺難以忘記，亦都係令到呢場運動踏入另一個轉捩點。

喺呢個紀念日，我決定改編一首歌，拍返條片，執埋首MV，送比所有同路人，追溯返呢一年令我地心痛、難過，但都有感動嘅時刻。而呢首歌就係來自 LA LA LAND，講嘅係發夢。雖然歌喉唔係特別好，但當係比自己嘅一份回顧，同送比任何睇到嘅同路人嘅一份禮物。


首歌有兩個版本，
英文版可以share比你的外國朋友，中文版就瘋狂 CLS 比手足吧💛

或者咁樣就係革命？有笑有淚，但感覺都係共同嘅。未必會贏，好大機會會輸，但無論結果係點，有你地呢班痴線佬同我一齊見證。

瘋子們，送給你們：誰追的夢。
呢個夢，我地一齊發。


It was the anniversary of the death of Mr Ling-kit Leung yesterday.

I have posted a song with both English and Chinese versions - The Fools Who Dream on my channel yesterday.

The song is originally from La La Land, and it is a song about dreaming. I wanted to use this song to trace back to some of the most sentimental, moving moments to me throughout the movement, and share them with you all in my singing, my revised lyrics and my video. I don’t sing well, but I just wanted to make it as a reflection to self, and a gift to whoever can see these videos.

This might be what a revolution is - we would smile, we would be in tears; and we might not win, in fact very likely losing, but at least I have had this beautiful dream with you all fools.

Dedicated to y’all: The Fools Who Dream.
I am honoured to go for this dream with you all.

//

歌詞（填咗好耐 比啲支持）

(獨白)
我曾經住喺香港
我記得，佢以前會返屋企然後同我講
香港爭取自由同民主嘅故事
我記得，佢同我講過佢係冇防備嘅情況下
食過一次催淚彈
佢眼都擘唔大

(唱)
縱 鬥志滿腔
也迴避至水馬旁
為香港為發聲
甚至瞎了眼睛
卻未放棄這使命

誰造的夢 曾經
愚昧 衝動 伶仃
沉重經歷難捨
難敵的漫 長夜

在家中又說起
勇武是與非
黃藍劃出距離
為志氣未畏高
用性命作 對賭
我常痛惜這命途

誰造的夢 曾經
愚昧 衝動 伶仃
無盡衝突 場景
誰造的亂 難證
卻 被 噤 聲

重光不是靠運氣
唯一出路為定理
當初講不撤不散
今昔方知太簡單

縱有 內鬥未算假
分化也未算差
肺炎下抗爭 都不怕

所以 誰造的夢 曾經
無懼催淚 提醒
宏願光復 情境
來日相認 為證

我 再次記起那夜
看 見那火光四射
擦過那眼睛
願再與手足去拼

—

English lyrics:

She used to live in Hong Kong
I remember, she used to come home and she would tell me
the fight for Freedom and democracy
I remember she told that she got hit by tear gas once, barefaced
She cried

Left, and still panting
And withdrew behind the fence
Had trouble in breathing
She spent a day sneezing
But said she would do it again

Here's to the ones who dream
Foolish as they may seem
Here's to the hearts that ache
Here's to the mess we make

She captured a feeling
A fight with no ending
Her family inside a frame
He leaped in the yellow
Died for the fellow
I'll always remember his name

Here's to the ones who dream
Foolish as they may seem
Here's to the hearts that ache
Here's to the mess we make
She told me

"A bit of madness is key
To give us new colours to see
Who knows where it will lead us?
And that's why they need us"

So bring on the rebels
The ripples from pebbles
They protest in exchange for peace

And here's to the fools who dream
Crazy as they may seem
Here's to the hearts that break
Here's to the mess we make

I trace it all back to then
Her, and the smoke, and the fence
Crying through it
She said she'd do it again
人呢

歌詞（填咗好耐 比啲支持）

(獨白)
我曾經住喺香港
我記得，佢以前會返屋企然後同我講
香港爭取自由同民主嘅故事
我記得，佢同我講過佢係冇防備嘅情況下
食過一次催淚彈
佢眼都擘唔大

(唱)
縱 鬥志滿腔
也迴避至水馬旁
為香港為發聲
甚至瞎了眼睛
卻未放棄這使命

誰造的夢 曾經
愚昧 衝動 伶仃
沉重經歷難捨
難敵的漫 長夜

在家中又說起
勇武是與非
黃藍劃出距離
為志氣未畏高
用性命作 對賭
我常痛惜這命途

誰造的夢 曾經
愚昧 衝動 伶仃
無盡衝突 場景
誰造的亂 難證
卻 被 噤 聲

重光不是靠運氣
唯一出路為定理
當初講不撤不散
今昔方知太簡單

縱有 內鬥未算假
分化也未算差
肺炎下抗爭 都不怕

所以 誰造的夢 曾經
無懼催淚 提醒
宏願光復 情境
來日相認 為證

我 再次記起那夜
看 見那火光四射
擦過那眼睛
願再與手足去拼

—

She used to live in Hong Kong
I remember, she used to come home and she would tell me
the fight for Freedom and democracy
I remember she told that she got hit by tear gas once, barefaced

Left, and still panting
And withdrew behind the fence
Had trouble in breathing
She spent a day sneezing
But said she would do it again

Here's to the ones who dream
Foolish as they may seem
Here's to the hearts that ache
Here's to the mess we make

She captured a feeling
A fight with no ending
Her family inside a frame
He leaped in the yellow
Died for the fellow
I'll always remember his name

Here's to the ones who dream
Foolish as they may seem

Here's to the mess we make
She told me

"A bit of madness is key
To give us new colours to see
Who knows where it will lead us?
And that's why they need us"

So bring on the rebels
The ripples from pebbles
They protest in exchange for peace

And here's to the fools who dream
Crazy as they may seem
Here's to the hearts that break
Here's to the mess we make

I trace it all back to then
Her, and the smoke, and the fence

She said she'd do it again

pinned.msg:
歌詞（填咗好耐 比啲支持）

(獨白)
我曾經住喺香港
我記得，佢以前會返屋企然後同我講
香港爭取自由同民主嘅故事
我記得，佢同我講過佢係冇防備嘅情況下
食過一次催淚彈
佢眼都擘唔大

(唱)
縱 鬥志滿腔
也迴避至水馬旁
為香港為發聲
甚至瞎了眼睛
卻未放棄這使命

誰造的夢 曾經
愚昧 衝動 伶仃
沉重經歷難捨
難敵的漫 長夜

在家中又說起
勇武是與非
黃藍劃出距離
為志氣未畏高
用性命作 對賭
我常痛惜這命途

誰造的夢 曾經
愚昧 衝動 伶仃
無盡衝突 場景
誰造的亂 難證
卻 被 噤 聲

重光不是靠運氣
唯一出路為定理
當初講不撤不散
今昔方知太簡單

縱有 內鬥未算假
分化也未算差
肺炎下抗爭 都不怕

所以 誰造的夢 曾經
無懼催淚 提醒
宏願光復 情境
來日相認 為證

我 再次記起那夜
看 見那火光四射
擦過那眼睛
願再與手足去拼

—

English lyrics:

She used to live in Hong Kong
I remember, she used to come home and she would tell me
the fight for Freedom and democracy
I remember she told that she got hit by tear gas once, barefaced
She cried

Left, and still panting
And withdrew behind the fence
Had trouble in breathing
She spent a day sneezing
But said she would do it again

Here's to the ones who dream
Foolish as they may seem
Here's to the hearts that ache
Here's to the mess we make

She captured a feeling
A fight with no ending
Her family inside a frame
He leaped in the yellow
Died for the fellow
I'll always remember his name

Here's to the ones who dream
Foolish as they may seem
Here's to the hearts that ache
Here's to the mess we make
She told me

"A bit of madness is key
To give us new colours to see
Who knows where it will lead us?
And that's why they need us"

So bring on the rebels
The ripples from pebbles
They protest in exchange for peace

And here's to the fools who dream
Crazy as they may seem
Here's to the hearts that break
Here's to the mess we make

I trace it all back to then
Her, and the smoke, and the fence
Crying through it
She said she'd do it again
